headline: Not the family feel that it once had!

cons: The bonuses are no longer attainable and on several occasions upper management took away the office bonus without any advance notice. 1 time it was gone for several months and nobody would tell us why it was removed and if it was ever coming back. Bonuses were set so high that it's common for less than 10% of the office to reach them.

headline: Great company and room for growth!

headline: Good Company..BUT RUN üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èfrom Collections Department!!
pros: GREAT CEO. Nice Coworker.Nice Paid time off.
cons: Sr. Management of collections department. They are completely inept and always doing underhanded things. Currently they keep trying to minimize your bonus payout and put all kinds of stipulations in the way to keep you from getting it. Yet they ALWAYS want you to sacrifice and give more time when department numbers are behind, only to help THEM look good.  People are currently leaving in DROVES which is why they are currently hiring and offering $1500 sign on bonuses..it's just THAT bad. But DON'T FALL FOR THE OKIE-DOKE.. the $1500 isn't worth it!! Until the Collections Sr. Management changes or changes their ways, I would look elsewhere!!

headline: Be ready
pros: I was with this company for well over 5 years. They were amazing when it came to helping you out when we had hurricane Harvey. Also when COVID hit the owner was concerned with the well being of all employees.
cons: This place can be the best place to work but also the worst depending on management. Once management changed in our department we lost 3 employees in a lapse of 3-4 months. Nobody was happy.

headline: WFM Analyst role in the collections department and FIFS have been great to me.
pros: A great place to work, the people and environment there are much like a big family. No complaints about pay and while I was salaried the collectors there had plenty of OT and bonus incentives.  The people there are amazing and friendly folks.  The leadership in Atlanta and Houston... Blaise, Lamar the directors etc...were absolutely some of the greatest guys I‚Äôve had a chance to work for.  Also I was impressed when the CEO and CFO came out to the floor, well done.
cons: I think there are areas of communication which could be better.  Also look to get more help with the network and system related issues.

headline: Excellent enviroment for those who are career minded
pros: The training is second to none.  Management support their departments to the furthest degree and ensure that professional development is ongoing.  Management creatively ensure that employees maintain a positive attitude toward career and others.  Management are not only approachable, they are accessible and are open to the ideas and concerns of employees.
cons: As with many companies the health benefits have been downgraded to some degree due to the national and statewide increase in premiums.

headline: okay job

headline: If you are offered a rep position do not take it.
pros: Approval rates are in the 5% range.  They will rarely allow a second unit.  They do not do self=-employed.  Bank statements out of the question.  Buyers are all on different pages.  Just a total mess in the credit department.   Complete waste of time
cons: You get to work from home and your boss leaves you alone except if you are in the central region where the manager is a control freak.  You get a slow cheap loud Malibu to ride

headline: Loan Processor
pros: You will get a steady paycheck and decent benefits. I have met some great people there. Casual dress code is fun.
cons:
-In the 2 years I have been with the company there has never been a bonus in our department. 
-I applied for a position in another department and later was told they were not going to put anyone new in the department; a few days later they create a new position for the department and move the management around as they wanted. 
-Favoritism is very obvious from department to department. 
-I do not trust the management or HR

headline: Team Lead Collector lll

headline: Financial Consultant

headline: Great place to work.

headline: Collections
pros: Extremely comfortable environment for lazy people

headline: I you want just a paycheck this is for you....if not look elsewhere
pros: It's a nice company to work for, if you're wanting to learn more in order to advance you can.
cons: Micromanaging, you won't become a manager, you can try to become a lead but that's it. There's really no advancing in this company. Pay could be way much better

headline: Company for the desperate and despondent
pros:
- Opportunity to learn about the subprime market of automobile lending
- Decent training and help available in learning most job functions
- A few nice supportive people
cons:
- If you have any type of college degree, you're too smart to work here. Most of the people are lower-middle class high school graduates and it's pretty obvious from their work ethic and lack of manners/morals.
- Technology is backward. They still use paper files!! Processes are slow and inefficient and most people, management included, don't know what they're doing.
- Communication is poor. When problems occur, people just try to find scapegoats.
- This company had a million dollar lawsuit filed against them because they weren't reporting customers' payments to the credit bureaus, which was resulting in these customers credit scores not being updated correctly.

headline: Decent pay
pros: Your base pay and bonus
cons: Getting cussed out by debtors

headline: Good job
pros: Teaching company. Welcoming environment. Great bonuses
cons: No social life at first but worth it. Pay is decent. Series 6 test hard.

headline: Loans
pros: Great place to work.  Casual dress code.  Good group of employees.
cons: The company plays "favorites" with employees.  Low salaries when the company make changes.

headline: Loan Officer
pros: Flexible schedule, decent overtime during peak seasons.
cons: This job doesn't require any education. I recommend someone that's just getting out of school with no experience to get the decent pay for a recent college graduate. No growth, lack of training, lack of resources, poor communications, 401K is horrible, no long term growth, no employee stock options, work almost every Saturday andvsimetime Sunday's. No educational or health promotions.

headline: Not much room for advancement.
pros: The employees you work with are nice. A job with this company is okay if you simply need a job while you look for something else.
cons: Low pay, micromanagement. Little room for advancement unless you are someone's favorite.

headline: Great learning experience but stressful.
pros: Benefits are plentiful and recently the company has integrated a learing tool called FIFS (First Investors Financial Services) University for its employees to continue in their learning abilities to progress in their current role.  The purpose of FIFS develops a learning organization that acquires the knowledge and core competencies that will sustain competitive edge and optimal performance.
cons: Not enough team building to keep team members motivated and activated. Opportunites for advancement are politically inclined and limited.

headline: Career Setback
pros: Good job if your just looking for something to pay the bills while you look for a better job
cons: Lied to about the job description. Basically a Call Center with paperwork on top of that. The management is terrible and don't have a good method to train new employees. Very hard to advance. The mangement prefers to keep people where they are. Pay is highly undervalued.
